abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Background</jats:title>
                <jats:p>Single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) and DNA methylation are crucial regulators of essential hypertension (EH). Amyloid precursor protein (<jats:italic>APP</jats:italic>) mutations are implicated in hypertension development. Nonetheless, studies on the association of <jats:italic>APP</jats:italic> gene polymorphism and promoter methylation with hypertension are limited. Therefore, this case–control aims to evaluate the genetic association of <jats:italic>APP</jats:italic> gene polymorphism and promoter methylation with EH in Guizhou populations.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Objective and methods</jats:title>
                <jats:p>We conducted a case–control study on 343 EH patients and 335 healthy controls (including Miao, Buyi, and Han populations) in the Guizhou province of China to analyze 11 single-nucleotide polymorphisms (rs2040273, rs63750921, rs2211772, rs2830077, rs467021, rs368196, rs466433, rs364048, rs364051, rs438031, rs463946) in the <jats:italic>APP</jats:italic> gene via MassARRAY SNP. The MassARRAY EpiTYPER was employed to detect the methylation levels of the promoters.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Results</jats:title>
                <jats:p>In the Han population, the rs2211772 genotype distribution was significantly different between disease and control groups (<jats:italic>χ</jats:italic><jats:sup>2</jats:sup> = 6.343, <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 0.039). The CC genotype reduced the risk of hypertension compared to the TT or TC genotype (OR 0.105, 95%CI 0.012–0.914, <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 0.041). For rs2040273 in the Miao population, AG or GG genotype reduced the hypertension risk compared with the AA genotype (OR 0.533, 95%CI 0.294–0.965, <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 0.038). Haplotype TCC (rs364051–rs438031–rs463946) increased the risk of EH in Guizhou (OR 1.427, 95%CI 1.020–1.996, <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 0.037). Each 1% increase in CpG_19 (− 613 bp) methylation level was associated with a 4.1% increase in hypertension risk (OR 1.041, 95%CI 1.002–1.081, <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 0.039). Each 1% increase in CpG_1 (− 296 bp) methylation level was associated with an 8% decrease in hypertension risk in women (OR 0.920, 95%CI 0.860–0.984, <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 0.015). CpG_19 significantly correlated with systolic blood pressure (<jats:italic>r</jats:italic> = 0.2, <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 0.03). The methylation levels of CpG_19 in hypertensive patients with rs466433, rs364048, and rs364051 minor alleles were lower than that with wild-type alleles (<jats:italic>P</jats:italic> < 0.05). Moreover, rs467021 and rs364051 showed strong synergistic interaction with EH (<jats:italic>χ</jats:italic><jats:sup>2</jats:sup> = 7.633, <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 0.006). CpG_11, CpG_19, and rs364051 showed weak synergistic interaction with EH (<jats:italic>χ</jats:italic><jats:sup>2</jats:sup> = 19.874, <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> < 0.001).</jats:p>
              </jats:sec><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Conclusion</jats:title>
                <jats:p>In summary, rs2211772 polymorphism and promoter methylation level of <jats:italic>APP</jats:italic> gene may be linked to EH in Guizhou populations. Our findings will provide novel insights for genetic research of hypertension and Alzheimer's disease.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec>
